alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 26 at 9:08PM MST until January 28 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM FRIDAY TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...A prolonged period of moderate to heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...East Central Wyoming into the northern Nebraska Panhandle including Converse and Niobrara Counties in Wyoming, and Sioux and Dawes County in Nebraska. This includes the cities of Douglas, Lusk, Harrison, and Chadron. * WHEN...11 AM MST Friday until 5 PM MST Saturday. The heaviest snow is expected mainly Friday night through Saturday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County
